intro: Staphidium novemnervium, commonly known as the nine-veined staphidium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and numerous stamens. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth margin and a prominent venation pattern. Staphidium novemnervium is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
